description: A unique square temple located on the summit of an earlier hillfort. Possibly a polygonal shrine nearby. Lewis (1966) suggests a chronology beginning in the mid 3rd CE and ending in the late 4th CE or possibly early 5th CE.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, et al, (2015), Chanctonbury Ring (West Sussex), available at: https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449
Smith, A., (2008), The Fate of Pagan Temples in Sount-East Britain during the late and post-Roman periods., in Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain
Rudling, D., (2008), Roman-period Temples, Shrines, and Religion in Sussex, in Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain
Rudling, D., (2001), Chanctonbury Ring revisited: the excavations of 1988-91, Sussex Archaeological Collections, 139, pg. 75-121, available at: http://dx.doi.org/10.5284/1000334
Bedwin, O., (1980), Excavations at Chanctonbury Ring, Wiston, West Sussex, 1977, Britannia, 11, pg. 173-222
Mitchell, G., (1909), Excavations at Chanctonbury Ring, 1909, Sussex Archaeological Collections, 53, pg. 131 ff
